required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: GANfort® in Patients With Primary Open Angle Glaucoma or Ocular Hypertension Who Are Insufficiently Responsive to Monotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: This is an observational study of patients diagnosed with Primary Open Angle Glaucoma (POAG) or Ocular Hypertension (OHT) who are insufficiently responsive to monotherapy and who are prescribed GANfort® (fixed combination of 0.3 mg bimatoprost and 5 mg timolol) by their physician.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Intraocular Pressure (IOP)
primary_outcome.description: IOP is a measurement of the fluid pressure inside the eye. A negative change from baseline indicates an improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Physician Assessment of Tolerability Using a 4-Point Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Physician assessment of tolerability using a 4-point scale (very good, good, moderate, and poor). The number of patients assessed as good and very good combined are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Assessment of Tolerability Using a 4-Point Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Patient assessment of tolerability using a 4-point scale (very good, good, moderate, and poor). The number of patients assessed as good and very good combined are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Physician Assessment of Adherence to GANfort®
secondary_outcome.description: Physician Assessment of Adherence to GANfort® was assessed on a 3-point scale (better, equal, and worse). The number of patients assessed as "better" compliance are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients Continuing With GANfort® After 18 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Patients continuing with GANfort® after 18 weeks was assessed as Yes or No.

arm_group.description: Patients with POAG or OHT prescribed GANfort® (fixed combination 0.3 mg bimatoprost and 5 mg timolol) treatment in a dose determined by the physician prior to study entry

intervention.intervention_name: Fixed combination 0.3 mg bimatoprost and 5 mg timolol
intervention.description: Patients with POAG or OHT prescribed GANfort® (fixed combination 0.3 mg bimatoprost and 5 mg timolol) treatment in a dose determined by the physician prior to study entry

study_pop.textblock: Patients with primary open angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension prescribed GANfort® (fixed combination 0.3 mg bimatoprost and 5 mg timolol) by the physician prior to study entry

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of primary open angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension
- Prescribed GANfort® (fixed combination 0.3 mg bimatoprost and 5 mg timolol)
Exclusion Criteria:

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
